alert.note: Alert for George; Greene; Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 08 at 3:22AM CDT until April 08 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT TODAY FOR THE WESTERN FLORIDA PANHANDLE AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST ALABAMA AND SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI DUE TO A COMBINATION OF LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES, 20 FOOT WINDS OF 15 TO 20 MPH, AND DRY FUELS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT LATE SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE WESTERN FLORIDA PANHANDLE DUE TO A COMBINATION OF LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES, 20 FOOT WINDS AROUND 15 MPH, AND HIGH ERC VALUES... ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI DUE TO A COMBINATION OF LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES, 20 FOOT WINDS AROUND 15 MPH, AND DRY FUELS... The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 7 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 052, 075, 076, 078 and 079. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 19 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
